channel.title: Example please
channel.description:
Well in my algebra data analysis class grade 8 (Lowered down version of Algebra I think) we just started doing some new work I would like if someone could show me examples of the following.
1: Solving Inequalities by Multiplication and Divsion 2: Solving Multi-Step Inequalities
If anyone can show me some examples thank you :)
Or link me 2 a good site that shows good examples ect

item.title: Example please
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

A fundamental tip: Inequality signs (>,<,>=,<=) reverse when you multiply or divide by a negative number.

For example we shall take 9-2x >= 5

9-2x >= 5 ~ Subtract 9 from both sides.
= -2x >= -4 ~ Divide both sides by -2. Reversal of sign takes place here as you are dividing both sides by a negative number. The same process would be taken if you were multiplying both sides by a negative number.
= x <= 2 ~ The answer.

The reversal or changing of Inequality signs is done according to the opposites of the signs. E.G. >= ~ <= AND > ~ < and vice versa.

Read full topic

item.title: Example please
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

its the same concept as linear equations, just instead of ‘operation = operation’ its ‘operation (>, <, >=, <=) operation’

edit: just read that you asked for example, so:

5x + 7 - 2 <= 10x + x - 7
5x + 5 = 11x - 7
5 = 6x - 7
12 = 6x
x = 2

now prove inequality:
5(2) + 7 - 2 <= 10(2) + 2 - 7
15 <= 15

Read full topic
